etymology.description: Depicts a person in a bent posture with an open mouth, suggesting the act of yawning or slackening
etymology.interpretation: The character 欠(欠) (qiàn, "yawn") visually represents a person with their mouth open, capturing the physical gesture associated with yawning. It symbolizes a relaxed or tired state.

examples.chinese: 上课时他总是打哈欠(上課時他總是打哈欠)，让老师分心(讓老師分心)。
examples.pinyin: shàngkè shí tā zǒng shì dǎ hāqiàn, ràng lǎoshī fēnxīn
examples.english: He keeps yawning during class, distracting the teacher.

examples.chinese: 会议中(會議中)，他不自觉地打哈欠(他不自覺地打哈欠)。
examples.pinyin: huìyì zhōng, tā bù zìjué dì dǎ hāqiàn
examples.english: During the meeting, he involuntarily yawns.
